CatDescriptText: Johnny Matlock, 708 Francis Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 1, 1958 pg 4 with question: "Should parents compel children who are still students in high school or college to work to help support the family?" answer reads: "I don't think that the child should be made to help to support the family. The parents should leave it up to the child as to whether or not he wants to give to the family."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Johnny Matlock wearing moustache, light colored scarf, and trench coat, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
